001
002package com.commercetools.docs.meta;
003
004/**
005 * {@include.toc}
006 * <h2>Querying the API</h2>
007 *
008 * <h3>Predicates</h3>
009 *
010 * <p>The system allows the use of <a href="https://docs.commercetools.com/api/predicates/query">predicates</a> when
011 * querying the API. Predicates are added as query parameter string to the request itself. The following example shows
012 * the usage of <a href="https://docs.commercetools.com/api/predicates/query#input-variable-examples">input variables</a></p>
013 *
014 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#queryPredicateVariable()}
015 *
016 * It's also possible to use array values in predicates in case of a varying number of parameters
017 *
018 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#queryPredicateVariableArray()}
019 *
020 * <h3>Get by id/key</h3>
021 *
022 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#getByIdOrKey()}
023 *
024 * <h3>Query all</h3>
025 *
026 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#queryAll()}
027 *
028 * <h3>Sorting</h3>
029 *
030 * <p>Please see <a href="https://docs.commercetools.com/api/general-concepts#sorting">Sort</a> for details</p>
031 *
032 * <p>Sorting using one parameter:</p>
033 *
034 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#simpleSort()}
035 *
036 * <p>Sorting using multiple parameters:</p>
037 *
038 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#multiSort()}
039 *
040 * <h3 id=pagination>Pagination</h3>
041 *
042 * <p>Limiting the number of the returned documents or page size:</p>
043 *
044 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#limitPagination()}
045 *
046 * <p>To retrieve the next results use the offset parameter. The example shows how to retrieve page 2:</p>
047 *
048 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#limitOffsetPagination()}
049 */
050public class Querying {
051}
